meanings.definition: Thin or slender in form or appearance
meanings.sent1: The tree branches grew spindlier as they reached towards the sky.
meanings.sent2: The cat's tail looked spindlier than the rest of its body.
meanings.sent3: The spindlier candles kept tipping over in the gentle breeze.
meanings.sent4: Her spindlier fingers delicately picked up the fragile glass ornament.
meanings.sent5: The spindlier figure of the model made the dress look even more elegant.

meanings.definition: Having long, thin legs or limbs
meanings.sent1: The spindlier spider scurried across the floor.
meanings.sent2: The deer had spindlier legs than the other animals in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The spindlier legs of the table made it wobble when someone leaned on it.
meanings.sent4: Her spindlier arms reached out to grab the book from the top shelf.
meanings.sent5: The spindlier branches of the tree resembled long, reaching arms.

meanings.sent1: The plant's leaves grew spindlier as it received more sunlight.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the old man's spindlier frame made him appear more fragile.
meanings.sent3: The spindlier threads of the spider's web shimmered in the morning dew.
meanings.sent4: As the days passed, her spindlier handwriting became harder to read.
meanings.sent5: The spindlier design of the vase gave it an air of elegance and grace.
